name: French in a Flash: Tricolore Berry Meringue Creams for Bastille Day
description: These easy-as-pie and light-as-air desserts start with bought meringues, topped with French vanilla whipped cream, and topped with bright summer berries. The blue, white, and red colors makes it perfect for Bastille Day.
recipeIngredient: 4 bought meringue nests, about 3.5 inches in diameter

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the cream and the vanilla seeds. Whisk until stiff. Stir in the sugar.
Arrange the meringue nests on a platter. Fill each with a quarter of the vanilla cream.

Arrange the berries on top. To make them look their best, arrange the raspberries first: a cluster of 3 opposite a cluster of 2. Fill in the gaps with the blueberries, and top with a strand of red currants. Serve right away, although these will keep okay covered with plastic wrap in the fridge for about an hour.
